news.title: Irish aviation and whiskey face hits as EU’s retaliation list to Trump tariffs takes shape
news.summary: The Irish aviation and whiskey sectors are bracing for the impact of tit-for-tat tariffs after bourbon whiskey and Boeing aircraft were included on a list of US goods to be hit with tariffs in the event that negotiations with the Trump administration fail.

news.title: Half of reforms RTÉ told to implement in wake of Ryan Tubridy payments scandal are delayed, report finds
news.summary: RTÉ has got a “must try harder” mark on its report card on reforms in the wake of the Ryan Tubridy payments scandal.

news.title: Joseph Grogan inquest concludes with widow in tears and bombshell accusations
news.summary: Lisa Flaherty stormed out of the packed room, visibly angered. The sugg­estion that she had been in a relationship with Joseph Grogan since she was 16 had caused his family “endless ­anxiety”, solicitor and senior counsel Damien Tansey was telling the court.

news.title: Daniel McDonnell: Cool heads the key to Shelbourne taking major Champions League step forward against Linfield
news.summary: With the eyes of the sporting world turning 60 miles down the road to Portrush, Shelbourne have also travelled north of the border to prepare for an exacting test of their resolution.

news.title: ‘She’s the one to win it for us’ – Máire Geoghegan-Quinn emerges as possible Fianna Fáil candidate for Áras
news.summary: Former European commissioner and cabinet minister Máire Geoghegan-­Quinn has emerged as a potential candidate for Fianna Fáil in the presidential election.

news.title: ‘I don’t get asked for selfies, people recognise only my voice,’ says RTÉ’s Claire Byrne
news.summary: RTÉ broadcaster Claire Byrne is rarely asked for selfies because it’s her famous voice that makes people do a double take.

news.title: The Indo Daily: DJ Carey’s Texas trips, Cancer Care and the Croke Park Conundrum
news.summary: DJ Carey was hailed as the “GAA’s first superstar”, a nine-time All-Star and twice Hurler of the Year. But behind the accolades, a deception played out across continents.

news.title: Ask a money coach: ‘My ex owes me more than €1,000. How do I get it back?’
Self-build story: ‘We were very concerned when the planning went up – but there wasn’t one objection’
news.summary: “This is where it all began,” says Norman Byrne, pointing to a small table at the back of a garden on a quiet, leafy street in Churchtown, Dublin.

news.title: Mary Regan: The budget will be glass half empty or half full – it just depends on whether you ask the Taoiseach or Tánaiste
news.summary: Cost-of-living measures in the budget are firmly out. The Coalition has been hardening its stance on the issue in recent weeks.
